website_summaries.verdict: A good looking pressure- mounted gate that is sturdy and does not damage your walls.
pros: Extensions can be offset for the gate to not be in the middle of the opening
Holds sturdy with its tension mounts
Holds up well over lots of usage
cons: This wide gate can extend to 60", which is not quite as wide or as versatile as some other extra wide gates on the market

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY if your dog chews stuff
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this gate for around 4-5 months now. It was annoying to setup but looked nice. My 18lbs dog was left alone for 20 minutes and he nearly chewed through two of the columns. My dog never chews anything and he was able to do that much damage in a short time. If your dog has issues with chewing, absolutely do not buy this gate. A dog bigger than him could chew through it in one bite, the wood is super flimsy and just barely above paper quality. I’m trying to figure out if I’m mad at my dog or at how cheap the wood was for him to be able to do that much damage.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy S.

customer_reviews.title: Product not even manufactured as listed/pictured!
customer_reviews.text: Purchsed item twice (in the listed and pictured black and brown color) and received the wrong color (brown and gray) both times. Suggested customer service via the manufacturer was worthless both by live chat and phone; everyone passing the buck. Come to find the manufacturer doesn't even make a gate as listed/pictured in the brown/black, only brown/gray or brown/brown. Tha k you Amazon for wasting my valuable time. As a thank you I will continue to utilize my free 2 day shipping until such time as I feel I've cost you more in continued return shipping (over and over again) than what I've paid you over the years. This should be fun, albeit inconvenient. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Pail

customer_reviews.title: Working great for my dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy! Easy to install. There were no instructions, but easy to figure out. I have two 70lb dogs and so far it is working great keeping them out of the kitchen and they have not tried to jump over. The size I needed in width was about 58 inches and it worked perfectly. The door sometimes is hard to close and doesn't align perfect, but it is attractive and matches the kitchen and is also sturdy. Fingers crossed it will continue to keep the dogs out!
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: LOVE MY GATE for our GSD puppy
customer_reviews.text: LOVE MY GATE for our GSD puppy! The mechanism is a little odd with a push-back and lift deal, but once you get the hang of it, it is fairly easy. What I especially like is the wide opening. It is much wider than your typical 'fancy' gates. Helps with carrying things through. I purchased this for a very low price because it was considered an open box. Actually it came in the product box and was slightly scuffed. NO PROBLEM - can't see it and I would have eventually scuffed it anyway! Overall - very pleased with this purchase! Important to note: the door actually stays open, which I absolutely love. My other gates are self-closing.
customer_reviews.author: P. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: A product that looks amazing, but ultimately fails!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely disappointed with this product. Normally Amazon is really reliable with the products they sell but this one leaves a lot to be desired. Very poor design in the mounting hardware. They give you this flimsy tool that easily bends and becomes useless and the rotating bolt slides when you tighten it and leads to the next problem: the three piece metal extension that bows when you tighten the mounting hardware. Just a poorly designed product that looks amazing, but fails in function and feels cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Casey C. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Cheap wood is easily chewed through
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep my 12yo dog out of the kitchen when I'm not home. I installed it on Saturday and by Thursday after work he was able to chew apart one of the wooden spindles of the door and get through the gate. I would have spent the $10 extra dollars and purchased the all metal gate if I had any clue that it would be so easy for him to chew through. I do not recommend this gate for pet owners.
customer_reviews.author: Clara

customer_reviews.title: The only worse wall is Trump's
customer_reviews.text: Wish I'd remembered where we had got the Munchkin gate before we ordered this poor portal. Fulfills basic promise of being a baby gate but not a good one. Went up easy enough, but the night and day difference in quality and function make me wrathful of it. You need 2 hands to close this thing. No tension device to make the door close behind you, the gate wont align at the locking position with anything resembling ease, especially at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Stuporous Funker

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality for such an expensive gate. Door has noticeable discoloration (not scratched, it’s smooth) and the wood is very lightweight/thin. Our toddlers play hard and I worry they’ll eventually break the gate down. The welding on the bars is awful where every metal piece meets. We also have difficulty lining the gate up and locking it into place at times, wonder if our gate is warped as others have reported. Docked stars for obvious quality issues but awarded two stars due to locking mechanism (very easy to use one handed when it lines up properly) and ease of installation (due to size was a two man job but completed in less than an hour)
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Zero starts if I could
customer_reviews.text: This gate is not sturdy it keeps pushing outward it won’t stay straight no matter how tight it is and so my 18 month old pushes it outward and then it falls off the walls .. if this gate didn’t bend inward and outward like it does, then she wouldn’t be able to push it outward and have it fall off .. waste of my money and waste of my time
customer_reviews.author: dia

customer_reviews.title: Not a good choice for a 60 inch opening!
customer_reviews.text: Oh man! This thing was SOOOO flimsy when using it for a 60 inch opening. The extensions dont have long enough connector rods. If anyone or anything leans into the gate it gives away! So disappointed after reading so many good reviews. The actual wood gate is poor quality also. Wood pieces are thin and you can tell exactly where they used itty bitty nails to attach the boards. Not impressed. Had to modify gate with extra wood to make it stable for a 60 inch opening. This gate would work perfect for a small dog or a large dog that is scared to touch a gate! Not for large jumping dogs or wild children.
customer_reviews.author: Cole Ripperger

customer_reviews.title: Bows and fails when extended
customer_reviews.text: This gate does not perform well when used at the maximum extension. It lacks the rigidity required and tends to bow to the point of falling over completely. Even when the gate is manually realigned, the bow factor prevents the latch from aligning and makes it cumbersome to close. A fix for this would be to increase the product height or to offer some additional support at the extension hinges. This would probably suffice if used for a typical door span, but just does not work for extended lengths. I would recommend buying a gate with a greater height or with reinforcement at the extension hinges if you are looking for something other than a typical door.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: If your house isn't brand new, with absolutely plumb angles, this isn't safe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to keep dogs out out a room. They have never tried to jump it, knock it down or breech it, but they do press up against it when they are excited. They are small dogs, so they aren't applying much pressure. It is impossible to get this gate to stay securely in place. There are two places where the panels intersect that will bow under the slightest pressure, and the gate will just come down. Definitely do not buy this if you have pets or children who will put the slightest pressure on the panels. It is not safe!!!
customer_reviews.author: J N

customer_reviews.title: Good durable investment
customer_reviews.text: We have a "doorway" that is about 62", so finding an affordable babygate that is durable and toddler proof was a challenge. I gave in to the price because cheaper gates just simply weren't working. So far, this gate looks great, once we figured out to put the opening part in the middle, it hasn't budged even with the kid tugging on the bars. It's a game changer that I don't have to literally jump hurtles anymore to avoid bumping the baby gate when it's in a "perfect" position. To install, it's best to have two people, to make sure the resistance and centering is correct. Overall, it was a great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine coleman

customer_reviews.title: I was livid at first
customer_reviews.text: I was sooo upset when I got the first gate sent to me because it looked completely crooked! No where in the manual did it mention a huge gap and crooked opening. After dealing with UPS stress... I had my replacement and this one had a sign on it. The sign basically says that its supposed to be crooked and have a gap... that after you apply the right tension to set it up the gap with close and it will straighten out! Now it looks great! But honestly, this was such a headache. PLEASE put this info in the manual too and I think the confusion would be avoided.
customer_reviews.author: nichole

customer_reviews.title: Not very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: When it came delivered the first box was pretty much ripped open and then the 2nd box inside was even worse. Used a ton of tape so it was clear they boxed this in a very poor box and didn't care. Gate is meh too and bought it to stop my dog from getting out of a room. He keeps pushing the gate open no matte how many times I try and fix it. Would not recommend to anyone for the price they're selling it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great gate!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the exact same one I bought five years ago. It is very sturdy and the extended size is perfect. Why did I have to replace it after five years? I use this outside on our deck because we have a dog. For added security, we screwed it into the deck posts. After enduring years of weather in the Northeast, the wood slats in the swing gate started loosening but it's not really intended to be outdoors. The fact that it lasted that long without rusting is a nod to the quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: L. M. Hoak

customer_reviews.title: Not for baby...for the dog! Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived early! That was so good. Installed in less than 1 hour and took the time to tweak installation location a couple of times. Easy! It is outside to prevent my dog from racing down the deck steps. Two surgeries, one on each rear leg, makes this a very worthy investment! And it WORKS!! Easy to use. My dog understands now that she can't run down OR UP the steps from one level to another. Super easy to install! Really! I can now let her out onto the upper deck and not worry! Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: PMP

customer_reviews.title: Poor design of simplest thing.
customer_reviews.text: Poor design. Holes in metal not aligned so had to switch placement of extensions. Gap is declared not to be a flaw but it IS; once together over 200# of pressure was place & gate would never close - 8” unfilled gap is a huge dangerous flaw. Simple design, poor execution. Worst product ever bought on Amazon; poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: A very well made beautiful product.  Easy to put together.  CANNOT ORDER REPLACEMENT EXTENSIONS.
customer_reviews.text: If anyone sells a product, they should also sell replacement parts. They do sell a separate bag of hardware, but NO 4" ,7" or 10" extensions. If a part becomes defective, you should be able to replace it. The gate (other than the one plastic snap and close) is beautiful. The gate extensions are metal and very nicely made, ya just can't buy replacements.
customer_reviews.author: vee

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Gate
customer_reviews.text: I do not easily part with my money. I take a really long time to research and make a choice. I am so glad I chose this product. It had all the extra pieces you could want should you decide to place the gate in a different size opening then the one you are purchasing it for. It looks really nice as well. I have crazy amounts of children using the gate daily and a brand new puppy resting weight on it as well. This is holding up just wonderfully. Follow the directions for installing, use the tool provided and you will have success. Trust me if I can do it, so can you.
customer_reviews.author: kelly baughman

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking dog gate
customer_reviews.text: We needed a wider gate for our entry way and this one fits. It looks very nice and opens easily. Our largest dog can push it and shove the sides out of line so I'll be getting some wall mount cups to keep the gate in place (he can also jump over the gate - but he's a really large lab/great pyrenees mix). When the sides are pushed in by the dog, the gate doesn't line up w/the top and bottom. If there was a 41 or 36 inch high version I would definitely buy that one.
customer_reviews.author: BlueMonkey

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, but frustrating to work with.
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, fits well in our opening. However disappointed. It’s like the gate is warped. The bottom has to be pulled/pushed as you do opposite with the top to get both to latch properly. I’m afraid the metal knobs that hold extensions to gather are going to break out. U can see the extension bending. I’d request sending it back but not sure can as my husband tossed out the packaging, ugh. In photos I had two extensions on one side to allow gate in middle of opening. Was unstable so I did move an extension on each side. However it helped some but not completely. Still seems like gate is warped. Wouldn’t buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Knock Over At Max Length
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based on sizing- i have an oversized opening, needed to keep Labs from free roaming. The only way it fits it w/ the side screws maxed out- this makes the gate totally unstable. My Lab has knocked it over multi times. IF they sold additional 4” extensions it would prob. solve the issue. They do not. They shouldn't advertise the length as they do. If this was at top of stairs a child could easily knock it over and fall down stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Harper B.

customer_reviews.title: Summer Infant Gate worked perfectly to keep our puppy in back yard.
customer_reviews.text: This gate was exactly what we were looking for, and we looked at what seems like 100's on the internet. It assembled easily and we used every inch of it's rated width. Works perfectly for keeping our puppy out of the driveway so he doesn't get dirty playing under the cars. This is intended to be an indoor baby gate but we're using it outside. So far doesn't look any the worse for wear or weathering. At some point I may give it a coat of varnish on the wooden parts and some carnauba wax on the metal parts. Highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: futbolref

customer_reviews.title: If you need a wide gate, look no further!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I’d found this sooner! It’s East to install, extremely sturdy, and it looks great! After trying an expansion gate which was flimsy, NOT dog proof, and left huge holes in our walls, we decided to try this gate. So glad we did! The only con is the bottom bar. It does take some conscious effort to not trip over it, but I’m sure that with time, it won’t be an issue. Overall we are very pleased. It’s well made and keeps our furbaby confined!
customer_reviews.author: Hollypopp

customer_reviews.title: Better safe than sorry 😉
customer_reviews.text: We actually purchased two gates. One for each side of our house to keep our dogs from running after critters. We live around lots of wildlife and the last thing we wanted was to have our sweet dogs gallop out of our reach and encounter something before we could catch up to them. Also you never know when a neighborhood child will wander up to your side gate trying to “see the doggy”. These gates just keep everyone safer in my opinion. My dogs don’t jump them. They open and close well. And so far, they have been durable especially for being outside. We’ll see how well they last through monsoon season.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel

customer_reviews.title: Totally recommend it
customer_reviews.text: There are three different sized extensions included with this gate (I used the single 10" extension) I installed the EZ Fit adaptor on the spindle and then installed the gate. I also purchased the Austor Baby Safety Wall Guard Pads Installation Saver Protect for Pressure Gates to protect the faux finish on the one wall. The gate latch is designed to push in the tab and pull up the gate and the same in reverse to close. It is super secure on the staircase and is really good quality material. I love it and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Sharma

customer_reviews.title: top of the line
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, cost a little more but you get a very good looking gate, very easy to open and close, no bending over or struggling to get things lined up, very well designed and very easy install, has several size entensions to fit about any opening, you want easy, good looking, works on up to five foot openings i believe, heck you could put two together and bridge a ten foot opening. very glad i paid a little more and got what i think is probably the best gate out there,
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Better than Target's Summer Infant gate, but...
customer_reviews.text: This gate is similar to the Summer Infant wide opening gate. This one is WAY better in that the latch is so much easier to work. However, this gate does NOT come with hardware to install it/secure it securely to the wall. The tension rods that come with this one have larger "feet" than my other Summer Infant gates, so I could not just slide it right into the SI hardware I had on the wall screwed in already. BUT, I just took the old tension rods from my other SI gate and slid them into this gate and voila, it works!
customer_reviews.author: JaneDane

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality controls
customer_reviews.text: Product has a great appearance for a baby gate. The quality is subpar. Product came in or manufactured without any quality checks apparently, as the gate was out of shape over 3". I bent the gate back as close as I could for it to latch and the welds started to tear. Now after calling Amazon I have to ship back this bulky large box that belongs on the scrap pile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sturdier then expected
customer_reviews.text: I needed a 5' gate that did not stick out into either room, The wide opening is nice. no one likes a baby gate but it solves a problem. Keeps baby contained. The gate swings both ways and the latch is secure, my 5 and 7 year old have no problem figuring it out and leaving it open all the time.. but that's nothing against the gate itself. The finish is good, Has to be aligned pretty good across opening or it doesn't line up great. kids climbing over it and it has not fallen over yet. easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan D

customer_reviews.title: Well Built But
customer_reviews.text: I used for a doggy gate for a small chihuahua and it works great. It’s well built but it’s easier to open with two hands than a single hand. Maybe my kids are to hard on it but I have to lift from the side closest to the hinge with one hand and unlatch with the other. Maybe a plus for some but not for me. Would I buy again yes would I recommend for sure. Just one little flaw in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: Got this gate for our dog. Works perfectly. I wouldn't recommend for a LARGE dog lol but for my 13/14 lb dog, it is perfect. We have a fenced yard but there is a walkway leading to it that is not blocked off and housing won't allow us to screw into the walls. This gate is perfect because it is pressure mounted and looks so nice!! I highly recommend buying the "wall savers" for pressure gates as it makes it feel so solid and doesn't feel flimsy. (It's worth the extra $11 ) Our opening was so large we needed that little bit extra. Happy shopping!
customer_reviews.author: LittleMrs.Mermaid

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this gate did not work. We could never get it tightened to the correct tension. I would not recommend this for a 60” opening, which is what we have. The box claims it will fit but it doesn’t.
customer_reviews.author: christyyoung

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it says, and does it well
customer_reviews.text: We are using this item as a barrier for our two dogs so that they do not have the run of the house. The gate installed well in a 58" opening and the friction fit elements work well. The gate is convenient in that it can swing either way which makes ingress/egress from both parts of the room quite straightforward. The fit and finish of the gate are top notch and it is quite sturdy. Our 65lb dog often puts his paws on the top of the gate (trying to train that out of him..) and the gate supports his weight and does not fall over.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Martin

customer_reviews.title: Wish the wood gate was metal!
customer_reviews.text: At first it seemed like a good sturdy gate. The wooden part of the gate is kind of cheap and not very strong. The wooden bars break easily. If the gate was the same material as the frame this would be a much better stronger and safer product.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install - does make some noise when opening/closing and requires 2 hands to operate
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install - the manual has all the configurations spelled out so you can easily figure out what extension pieces you need to assemble! The only thing I would mention about this gate is that it is does make some noise when opening and closing and it takes two hands to operate (one to push the latch open and a second hand to lift the gate). I used this pressure-mounted gate in conjunction with wall cups by VMAISI ( to make it more secure.
customer_reviews.author: K N

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, but wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.text: These were easy to install and look pretty good for what they are. However, they are an absolute pain in the @ss to close. You have about a half inch target when lifting and lowering to latch them closed. I purchased and installed 2 of them and wish I would have gone a different route. My older children have a hard time closing them and often give up and leave them open, defeating the purpose of having a baby gate in the first place. I wouldn’t recommend or purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeHobbiest

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly nice looking for a dog gate!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this more for utility than looks, but it excels in both areas. The grey looks way better than I thought possible, and the wood looks sturdy and rich. Even the top curve adds a nice touch. I installed this on a 44” opening to my kitchen. I used the middle size extension which fits perfectly. The install took about 10 mins, including unpackaging. I thought lifting the door to open the gate might be cheap or annoying - it’s neither. The lock button and lifting maneuver is really easy. Also, the gate opens in either direction which is very convenient. It looks so much nicer than the all-white or all-wood gates I’ve purchased over the years!
customer_reviews.author: Big Kid

customer_reviews.title: Gate
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this gate because we have a fairly larger opening between our living room and dining room. This fit perfectly! It took a little time to install, just to simply get the right pieces so it fit the opening, but I wouldn't call it difficult by any means. I love the look of this gate as well, we knew we'd have this around for a while and wanted something that looked nicer. Overall it's a winner!
customer_reviews.author: Brianne

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with the gate overall. The wide gate and ability to open either direction is so convenient. I am glad it had several extensions so I can use it in the space I have especially since I had issues previously finding a good fit. My only annoyance is the way the gate latches- it seems to be really touchy and hard to latch at times which is frustrating. Overall however I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Luiken

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pet Gate for Outside
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a solution to make my balcony a safe place for my pup to be play outside but not be able to squeeze thru slats. This is a fantastic product. The way it tightens allowed me to not have to attach the 2 boards to the railing or the wall. Now that I know it works and doesn't fall over when the gate is open, or left open, I'm going to trim and paint the boards and leave this up until it starts raining.
customer_reviews.author: Joanie Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Saves our baby!
customer_reviews.text: This gate is by far one of the best purchases I’ve gotten off Amazon. Our baby boy is a beast and likes to destroy things. This gate doesn’t budge even with all my kids coming and going all day. We have large stairs going to front door and this has been amazing at keeping our baby from falling down. This gate is as functional as it is cute.
customer_reviews.author: TPhillips

customer_reviews.title: Extremely well built!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when ordering but with few options I decided it was worth the risk. I was pleasantly surprised at the quality! This is a VERY well designed and built gate! It holds very securely and even looks nice! It’s 100 pound dog proof! It was tested immediately after installing. Installation was quick & easy. No need to modify anything and it won’t damage your walls. As usual, shipping was quick. Again, very impressed and extremely happy!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff P

customer_reviews.title: At least it looks good.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this on a 5' wide opening and it the whole thing bends in the middle where the 2 pieces meet. If you pressurize the gate to where it doesn't slip off, it bends. When I put a "magic mover" under the middle of the gate it has better support. If this was one piece it would be sturdy enough but it kind of serves it's purpose of keeping dogs out of a room (except my big one who uses his big head to open the gate). I would not recommend this for use as a baby gate in a wide doorway. It would be dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: studygirl

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely LOVE this gate!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to put this gate up myself so that should say how easy it was. I needed a gate for the huge opening from my kitchen to living room. I was worried that it might be too light and flimsy for such a big area. But once the gate is up and tight it's perfect! I have a Great Dane and she likes to lean on everything. She hasn't even moved the gate one bit. It's a nice looking gate and especially for such a great price. Easy to get the hang of opening! Would definitely recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: GreatDaneMom

customer_reviews.title: Not Sturdy, keeps coming off
customer_reviews.text: This door is not sturdy, it keeps moving no matter how strong you secure it. Also, you can't secure it more than certain space otherwise the door won't close. This door has annoying locking mechanism and requires the door to be fully aligned before you close and the door always looses alignment.
customer_reviews.author: SyS

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, works great, but dog chewed through
customer_reviews.text: The gate looks fantastic, works well and was relatively easy to install. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is for durability. I bought this when I brought home a new dog, to keep her in her room when I'm gone. I soon discovered that Artemis is a chewer when left alone. She actually ate through the wooden bars and escaped a couple times. She has since calmed down and I patched the gate, but I will probably upgrade to all metal. If your dog is not a chewer or you're using this for a kid, I highly recommend. If you do have a chewer might want to consider metal.
customer_reviews.author: nadams

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to line up and close
customer_reviews.text: Very nice gate. However, I just find it hard to line up at times when you’re closing it. I stand there and struggle to find just the right spot for it to drop and lock in place which can be very frustrating when holding a squirmy baby. Most of the time it requires me gently touching the bottom of the gate with my foot to get the gate to line up.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Dietrich

customer_reviews.title: This gate is beautiful. When compared to other gates it really looks ...
customer_reviews.text: This gate is beautiful. When compared to other gates it really looks nice especially if you have nice woodwork. I also liked that it had a door that swung both ways. However... the pressure pads that hold the gate up are NOT secure. Even if you tighten them as much as humanly possible when you push against the gate it slides slowly. A toddler with patience could topple this gate. I bought it for the doorway of our stairs that go down and am afraid to keep using it as our son could push his weight against it and after maybe 10 minutes it would topple over and go down the stairs... our son with it.
customer_reviews.author: Acoustic_Shadow

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: it does the job by keeping my puppy out of the kitchen, I like the material. the only thing I dislike is that while trying to open it it gets stuck at the bottom while trying to lift up on the handle and at times I've noticed since we installed it this morning it won't come up and open. I have to do it more than 1 time. kinda defeats the purpose of lifting it up 1 time. for the price, it should be fail-proof. my son said the handle needed to be in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: theresa douglas

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product.
customer_reviews.text: I was on the hunt for a sturdy “baby” gate for my two dogs for a while now and couldn’t find anything that wasn’t either hideous, big enough for my walkway, or super cheap and janky. This gate is AMAZING. It’s SUPER sturdy, if you install it per instructions; my dogs have jumped on this multiple time and I haven’t had to readjust or tighten it at all. It comes with multiple adjustment sizes to fix different door opening sizes. And also very easy to install—I did it on my own, which means a chimp could probably do it. HIGHLY recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a gate.
customer_reviews.text: It was pretty difficult to install, and they do get un adjusted over time and require some maintenance. But they are holding up well to my 2 puppies and my daughters dog. Only thing I wish it had was more of a slope up for the guide on the top latch so you didn't have to lift it up and aim it with quite as much focus. but over all not too much of a pain. I would get it again.
customer_reviews.author: Ttsnuffy

customer_reviews.title: Charged full price for a used gate
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this gate and when it arrived it looked new. However, when we were assembling it, we noticed it was used. Amazon didnt let us know we'd be getting a used product. The tags, and instructions were missing. The gate itself was sticky. On top of that I'd have to pay to ship it back to them so we just decided to make it work. The product itself is ok but not great in comparison to another gate we have. For the price I do not think its worth it.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Warped and Missing Pieces
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited to get this gate today but things turned south quick. One whole side piece was completely missing. So, we thought we might have them send another, but then we looked at the middle arched part and it was warped and not even close to being able to align and close to the outer bar. We were going get a replacement but upon further inspection we decided to go with another gate due to the quality of this product. I normally don't leave bad reviews but this one was well deserved.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: used for 6 weeks..
customer_reviews.text: loved it at first but then after a few weeks it kept popping out and curving in the middle..would not stay straight. We have a few different gates and this is the only one that has ever damaged our walls. we used all the extenders for wide opening so maybe it works better for just door frames
customer_reviews.author: Ashley C

customer_reviews.title: Bends when installed
customer_reviews.text: This gate looks great, but as soon as I installed it it started to bend and only got worse. I tried a few different positions and made it at right as possible, but it still bent so badly that the ends were only touching the walls by the every corners making it impossible to open and close properly. Pretty bummed out after spending this much for a simple item.
customer_reviews.author: Clay S

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice for what it is
customer_reviews.text: This gate looks great for what it is. It is sturdy and keeps my giant mastiff out of my living room when I'm not home. The extensions are nice and, while it would help to have a 2nd person, it can definitely be put up by yourself. The one thing I don't like is that when closing the gate the latch isn't always the easiest to get into the right position and it takes longer than it should.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Ross

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as hoped
customer_reviews.text: It looks good and seems fairly solid, but it does not open and close neatly, as the top ends collapse toward the gate when the gate is open. It appeared warped when it came out of the box but after considerable work, we finally got it to function acceptably.. I considered returning it but this is such a hassle, and we ultimately decided to work with it if possible and though it works as I said, I am going to apply some more hardware to it to anchor the upper ends to the wall to hopefully help the gate work better.
customer_reviews.author: Donna D. Braendel

customer_reviews.title: Aesthetically pleasing and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this baby gate to keep our baby from getting out of the living room and it’s exactly what we were looking for. We needed an extra wide gate that was aesthetically pleasing, this fits perfect and matches our decor perfectly as well. Super easy instructions for installation just wish the tool they provided for securing to the wall was a little more user friendly for tight areas. We’ve had this gate for a while and our now 1 year old hangs/bangs/pulls on it and it hasn’t moved an inch. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Wisniewski

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed to contain the dog
customer_reviews.text: It's great that you can make the door off center. Hubby said it was easy to put together. One hand to open the gate. It's a tiny bit tweaked so to close it, you have to use your foot to line up the bottom with the top. Could be an installation error on our part. We like it tho. Looks good too. Really stays in place.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Adams

customer_reviews.title: Flexible Gate
customer_reviews.text: Flexible product as the extensions are removable to allow the owner to customize the fit for the doorway in question. Like the design of metal frame with the wood door, nice touch. Pairs well with a Wall Nanny to keep from drilling holes and damaging product. Recommended buy as it was purchased for dogs.
customer_reviews.author: CWalk

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this gate without hesitation. Purchased for pets.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a person who finds installation easy, so for even the simplest thing I struggle. I did get it done! The gate is wonderful! It's good looking and very well built. I purchased it to keep my small dogs out of the kitchen. The walk through gate is easy to use. I would recommend this gate without hesitation!
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Really nice gate. Using it to keep my dog out ...
customer_reviews.text: Really nice gate. Using it to keep my dog out of my bedroom. She gets into everything, gate is sturdy, looks very nice. Easy to open and close. Great instructions, shows you exactly what pieces to use for the size you need to put it together. I saw another gate but didn't like the looks of it, but it said the bottom was padded so it wouldn't scratcth hardwood floors. This one is a nicer looking gate, I bought stick on padding it works great floor won't get scratched,, only took me a few minutes to install! I recommend buying it!
customer_reviews.author: Bargin shopper

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and functional
customer_reviews.text: This gate is sturdy and looks quite nice. I use it to block the large entryway from the front door so my dogs are contained where I want them. They’ve tried to knock it down or go over it and so far they haven’t been able to get past it. I’ve had this about 6 months and it’s still looking brand new. It was well worth the money. It’s well made.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this gate. I use it to keep my dogs out of the portion of the house with carpet. I also like that it looks permanent and can be without drilling holes into the walls. I admit that it took me some time to figure out that the tension had to be set correctly before the gate will close properly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fantastic in ALMOST every regard.
customer_reviews.text: Great gate, build quality etc, for the price! Only gripe is it should have a flare to slide it in easier, shutting it is really a pain, but you get used to it. Surprising they didnt think of that when they designed it?! Also, surprisingly stought, you would think that a gate with a door wouldnt be firm, cause there no bar on top, but its designed with pre baked in tension on the lock side, so it actually is really strong. Dont get this gate if you plan on needing a gate to move around the house...
customer_reviews.author: William K. Young

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Man, these are great. We've got five of them, I think, throughout the house. Very easy in and out, easy to set up, they stay in place pretty securely, and they look great. You're going to be living with these things in your house for a few years, so you might as well get gates that are easy to use and look good. The only complaint I have is the lubrication at the hinge appears to be low after several months' use. If I lift them at the hing side, they come up super easy, but they've started to stick quite a bit when lifting at the handle side. I'm going to have to get in there and re-lube them.
customer_reviews.author: Keith N. Popely

customer_reviews.title: New gate for dogs
customer_reviews.text: After scrolling through tons of gates, we went with this one. The width of opening was great and the wood/metal construction looked great. My husband installed it easily at the bottom of our stairs to prevent dogs from going upstairs. Wall on one end and the newell post on the other, no screws used on this gate. Door latches well, my 7-yr-old grandson figured it out right away, and it seems like it will hold up well. It's only been a few weeks but so far no issues. Also bought Wall Nanny supports and together my husband says it seems like a very stable set up.
customer_reviews.author: Katliz

customer_reviews.title: A Lifesaver to Separate our Small Dogs!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter moved back in with me for a few weeks. Her chi/pug (25 pounds) doesn’t get along with my chi/doxie, so I ordered this gate to keep her dog in the front room. The gate was perfect! Very sturdy. Stayed put on the baseboards without damaging them and was easy for us to pass through with one hand or step over (but we’re long-legged). I wish I had bought this years ago when they lived with me!
customer_reviews.author: S.W.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this gate to fence off my kitchen and deter my 18 month old from climbing the kitchen table. It was easy to install however it was very unstable. Once installed you could clearly see that it was bowing. It didn’t take much effort to wriggle the gate and knock it over. I returned to amazon for fear that it would cause serious injury to my toddler as it was somewhat heavy. It fit my space that was 59in across with the attachments that come with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Attractive gate, but hard to close
customer_reviews.text: The gate looks really nice, it's also very sturdy. The close it, you have to line up a tiny bit of plastic on top AND you have to line up the bottom of the gate to the frame at the same time. I usually have to use my foot to scoot the bottom part into place and use my hand to line up the top of the gate.
customer_reviews.author: Kwillie

customer_reviews.title: It looks nice and serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: I'm not crazy about this gate. It looks nice and serves its purpose, but the two latches (one at the bottom/one at the top) don't line up well when closing this gate. I have tried tightening the tension nuts/screws but this makes it harder to open. I have also checked to make sure it is aligned properly with levelers. Other than a design flaw, my only other guess would be that I received a defective product. Its too much of a hassle to return it and set-up a new one so I'll make do with it.
customer_reviews.author: MDH

customer_reviews.title: Looks good!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my dog. She chewed it a little, but it still looks nicer than most! Good price and works better than those without doors because you can fit it to your opening easier. Also better for dogs because the bars only go vertical. (She could climb the old one at only 3 months old. I literally watched the little stinker escape. Picture attached.) I will say she can get her head through still at 17lbs, but I can tell that won't last much longer! If you have a dog with a medium sized head, be careful as they could get stuck.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Love this gate. We live in an old house, where hardware installing is not an option. Finding a large pressure mounted gate was a bit of a challenge. But this one was perfect. Have had it for about 3 weeks and is still stanging strong despite 4 kids beating up on it! And I love that the gate opens both ways!!
customer_reviews.author: Chrystal Chuc

customer_reviews.title: Second time I bought one of these!!!
customer_reviews.text: My three year old son broke our first one when he decided to use the open gate as a battering ram on his toy train (he is the size of a five year old with the strength of a seven year old and doesn’t realize it lol). But before that happened we had our first one three years and it was in great condition after my crazy child, two dogs, and a husband who is tough on everything. I just had to replace it with the same one because I loved it so much!!! And it looks sooooooo much nicer than all the other gates I have ever seen. It’s gorgeous!!
customer_reviews.author: kerby

customer_reviews.title: Its just ok
customer_reviews.text: This arrived slightly bent and with a chip in the wood. I did get it at a good discount so I guess maybe that was because it was used? We needed it immediately so have made it work with the addition of bracing materials and fasteners drilled into the porch and siding. The latch isn’t great. My sister in law got the same one and while hers isn't used/ bent it still is off a bit and the latch is difficult to function. Maybe this is just the nature of dates like these.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer binks

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This product was exactly what we needed to keep the dogs out of the room while providing access for the rest of us. I didn’t want a plastic gate and I didn’t want to screw it in. This works perfectly, was a breeze to install, and I love the versatility it offers if we need to use it in another doorway.
customer_reviews.author: thriftymom

customer_reviews.title: Not worth ny time or money
customer_reviews.text: This product disappointed me all the way around. Product box was damaged but thought it was from shipping. Opened it to find scratches on the wood portion and a end cap missing from one of the extensions. Assembled it and as the ppressure mounts tightened the center of the gate bowed where the extensions connect. Once installed (still bowed) my grandaughter came to the door, lifted the door and opened it without having to engage the top lock at all to open, then she leaned on it and the entire gate gave at the bow. Packing this thing back up and returning it today.
customer_reviews.author: Carys Judd

customer_reviews.title: Broken by Cat
customer_reviews.text: Less than a month our cat ran into it and broke one of the wooden slats. With a lot of wood glue and patience I pieced it back together. Not sure how this would be safe or secure for a small child if it breaks so easily. We went with this model because the wood was pretty but we also have the Regalo extra tall gate and it has held up through 3 large dogs, house party’s, 3 cats and a bunny. I would buy that gate again over the Summer Infant.
customer_reviews.author: aaron fortin

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: We have had the gate a couple years & it has been wonderful! I loved that it was adjustable to fit many door openings. My four year old can open & close the gate but it works well to keep the dogs & my 2 year old out of the kitchen. We also have a full grown cat, she can fit between the rails to go back & forth.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Molholt

customer_reviews.title: Ehh
customer_reviews.text: I love the style of this gate but with everything as even as it can get, it is so hard to close this. It says it's for 1 hand but when I'm holding the baby, it's insanely hard to get it closed. I have to use my foot to push the bottom latch and keep it aligned with the top button. I had to buy 2 of these for the archways I have in my living room and I'm a bit disappointed in them. When I'm not holding my baby, I usually jump over them.
customer_reviews.author: Kalissa

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a wisebuy!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 3 gates in the last couple of months to puppy proof our home. All three were the wooden type (cheesy pine) with plastic netting...and pretty much complete junk. 1 still works, the other 2 are in the landfill...avg cost was about $45. The gate I just received via Amazon from Summer Infant....is fabulous! Much better than expected. Study, very well engineered and a real value. I totally recommend....and btw I also ordered the wall savers that were a big help in securing the installation.
customer_reviews.author: Relsberg

customer_reviews.title: I owned it for less than nine months and now it is ready for the garbage. I would not recommend this gate
customer_reviews.text: My small dog of 6 lbs. ripped one of the wooden bars off the gate and chewed it, so I cannot even glue it back. She can now fit into the space where the wooden bar is missing. The gate has become worthless to me. I owned it for less than nine months and now it is ready for the garbage. I would not recommend this gate.
customer_reviews.author: Addie

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: There is a little sway to it, so you do have to line it back up every now and then and it's not as sturdy as a wall mounted gate for wide openings, but it still hold up pretty well to our active toddler. It also looks great, and if you just add a little cooking spray to the bolt where it lifts up to open, its super easy to open/shut. All and all, we love it and it has worked out great for us. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: laryssa clark

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Gates and only 1 out of 3 came bent
customer_reviews.text: We have ordered three of these since we moved. We moved into a three story house and have two babies two and under so blocking off all them stairs is essential. These are beautiful gates and I am only docking it a star because one of the three came with the wooden gate bent. It doesn't bother me much but its frustrating for my wife getting the bottom to line up with the top because of it. I also purchased wall bumper cups because our last house the kids messed up the paint trying to shake the gates down but so far these gates are super tight and don't appear to be budging or doing any damage to the walls.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler F. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a better price than alternatives!
customer_reviews.text: This gate is perfect for our needs (one year old trying to get in the kitchen and eat dog food, dig in the trash, and clear out cupboards... normal life lol). I like that it is pressure mounted so we can easily move it to another spot or house, if we move. Our space is 5ft (60in) across so it limited our options for gates and many options were close to $150 or $200. This gate was much less expensive and gets the job done well. I like that the panels to extend the gate can be placed on either side of the walk through section. We placed them all on one side to work with our layout.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: incomprehensible stupidity sold
customer_reviews.text: Poorest possible quality control in inspection prior to shipping .wasted my afternoon , requiring me to return, reshop for another gate.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: i had high expectation based on the price and reviews, but again i was fooled by reviews. this product is hard to install because the gate will not close until it is perfectly aligned. furthermore, even though you install it correctly and tight up the screws / bolt or whatever, it does not stay sturdy. a 15 months old baby can pull pieces of the gate off balance. I would not recommend it all.
customer_reviews.author: ten

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but requires insane pressure
customer_reviews.text: Comes with a gap on purpose for the gate. The point is that the pressure of the whole thing mounted pushes the gate together so that it can close. The problem is that it requires a GREAT deal of pressure. Bought some spacers to help protect the wall and they just disintegrated trying to scoot them in to create pressure to mount the gate. Ended up having to take the spacers off. Maybe have the gate actually close even without insane amounts of pressure? Just be ready to put dents in your walls.
customer_reviews.author: TRVTH

customer_reviews.title: The beautifully finished metal frame and the decorative wooden gate look ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a Superbly designed and well built gate. I was looking for something that was secure and didn't require me to make permanent holes in my wall or woodwork. This gate is just what I was looking for. The beautifully finished metal frame and the decorative wooden gate look great and not at all out of place. The Gates hardy construction and 31" height are perfect to keep our Giant Sized dog out of "people only" areas of the house. This gate comes with three adapters that allow it to work in openings up to 60". I am VERY happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Neil A. Schoenherr

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and Functional
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this gate to install in a wide entry way after we adopted a dog who was not exactly 'cat friendly' (even tho we were told he was). The gate is attractive, was easy to install and sturdy even with the wider width. The only thing I'm not excited with is the latching mechanism, which can be difficult to release.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE GATES
customer_reviews.text: Love these gates. Purchased a total of three after installing the first one. Love the easy opening and closing. I’m training a big puppy! You do need to make sure you keep the gate well aligned. I put my second one up and realized I was pushing it a bit one way. I thought it would not matter but it caused closing to be difficult- or awkward. I loosened it and adjusted it to be straight and now open and close is easy. If you find difficult I would double check this. I also get compliments on the look and quality of these gates and highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: GreyHorse

customer_reviews.title: WIDE OPENING, Best Baby Gate we’ve found
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best baby gate we’ve found. Not only is it pressure mounted but it also has a nice WIDE opening. (I will update my review with measurements later when I can). And as a bonus it looks great too. The wood matches the wood on our stairs banister and goes quite well with our decor.
customer_reviews.author: Barton D.

customer_reviews.title: held up for over 2.5 years
customer_reviews.text: I got this gate 2.75 years ago and have installed it outside on a deck that gets full sun and rain. It has held up and is 'weathered' but still durable and functions perfectly. Would highly reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: I love everything about this gate
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this gate! It was very easy to install (although I initially thought the "gap" would never work!). It looks really classy (much prettier in real life). I love that it swings in either direction effortlessly. The closure is a very nice design. The whole gate is very solid and sturdy (it withstands our puppy trying to knock it down!). It's a great gate. Everyone comments about how nice it looks and how easy it is to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Just terrible!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this gate and it came broken so we returned it and got the same type of gate in its place which also came broken! Just terrible!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice gate
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves the look of this gate and I love that it works for my dogs when guests are over. I have 120 pound senior shepherd and a 8 pound shih tzu. They are not jumpers, so it works perfectly to keep them corralled in their doggie area when we have visitors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you order/receive the wrong size...
customer_reviews.text: ...you have no choice but to return it, because although Summer Infant manufacturers many sizes of extensions, they refuse to sell any of them. My problem would have been solved with just one small extension, but instead I have to repackage, return, and reorder—an unnecessarily difficult solution compared tosimply selling me the additional part. Boo!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Noisy and frustrating
customer_reviews.text: This gate is no good- it is so noisy to latch the gate- you will wake up your sleeping child. It is very hard to put together with all the extended pieces and keep latch lined up. Also, it was missing a screw. So I had to improvise with something from a Home Depot. Ugh, frustrating. I would return but box got tore up when opening. Bummer
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Gibson

product_meta.title: Summer Decorative Wood & Metal Safety Baby Gate, New Zealand Pine Wood and a Slate Metal Finish – 32” Tall, Fits Openings up to 36” to 60” Wide, Baby and Pet Gate for Doorways
product_meta.description: Child proof your home in style with the Summer Decorative Wood & Metal Safety Baby Gate. Made of New Zealand pine wood with a slate metal finish, this baby gate will complement any home décor. Have added peace of mind knowing that this sleek gate accommodates doorway installation. Easily install this baby gate by using the no drill doorway mount for in-between doorways. With the 3 included extensions, this 32” tall baby gate can fit openings up to 36” to 60” wide making it the ideal gate for toddlers and small pets.
feature_bullets: ACCOMODATES MOST OPENINGS: The Summer Decorative Wood & Metal Safety Gate for Baby can be used between doorways. With the 3 included extensions, this 32” tall baby gate can fit openings from 36” to 60” wide.
EASY INSTALLATION: Easily install this baby gate by using the no drill doorway mount for in-between doorways.

ONE HAND WALK-THRU: When used between rooms, this baby gate has an extra wide hinged swinging door that opens in either direction. Plus, it can be operated with just one hand for ultimate convenience when moving between rooms.
SAFE AND SECURE: Have peace of mind knowing your baby or pet can explore safely with this high-quality baby gate from Summer.

STYLISH BABY GATE: This decorative baby gate is made of New Zealand Pine wood with a slate metal finish, so you can child proof your home in style. Standing 32” tall, it is ideal for use with toddlers and small pets.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,067 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
